samples.current_output: Complaint options: 1) State Mental Health Authority, 2) Mental Health Review Board (district level), 3) Human Rights Commission (SHRC/NHRC), 4) Police (if physical/sexual abuse), 5) Health Department. Types of abuse: Physical restraints misuse, no consent treatment, inhumane conditions, denial of communication with family. Evidence: Photos if possible, witness statements, medical records.

Mental Healthcare Act 2017 rules: 1) Nominated representative (patient designates when competent), 2) Family members (spouse, parents, sibling - in order), 3) No one available: Hospital board decision. Advance directive: Patient can write treatment preferences when competent. Involuntary admission: Only if danger to self/others - magistrate approval needed within 24 hours.

samples.instruction: Tulsi plant benefits enna? Eppadi use panradhu?
samples.current_output: Tulsi (Holy Basil) benefits: 1) Immunity booster, 2) Respiratory health (cough, cold, asthma), 3) Stress relief (adaptogen), 4) Blood sugar regulation, 5) Antibacterial, 6) Heart health. Uses: 1) Fresh leaves - 3-5 daily (chew), 2) Tulsi tea - leaves boiled in water, 3) Tulsi drops - available commercially, 4) Tulsi honey - cold remedy. Note: Avoid during pregnancy (in large amounts), blood thinner users. Grow at home: Easy, brings positive energy (traditional belief).

Apply process: 1) Taluk office / Primary Health Centre visit, 2) Documents: Ration card, Aadhar, income certificate, photos, 3) Biometric enrollment, 4) Card delivery: 15-30 days. Online check: cmchistn.com. Already rice card holder: Automatic enrollment - check status online. Missing card: Duplicate apply at same office.

NO! Illegal to refuse emergency. Law: Every hospital (government/private) must provide emergency care. Stabilization mandatory before transfer. Cannot ask for: 1) Advance payment, 2) Police clearance (accident), 3) ID proof. MLC cases: Treatment first, formalities later. Violation: Criminal prosecution + license cancellation. Report: 108, police, Health Department.

Government: 1) Government Yoga and Naturopathy Medical College, Chennai, 2) District AYUSH hospitals (Naturo units). Private: 1) Jindal Naturecure Institute, Bangalore (near TN), 2) Nature Cure Hospital, Chennai, 3) Various wellness resorts. Services: Hydrotherapy, mud therapy, massage, diet therapy, yoga. Duration: 7-21 days programs. Cost: Government free/nominal, Private Rs.2,000-8,000/day. Good for: Diabetes, BP, obesity, stress, detox.

Decision hierarchy: 1) Advance directive (if patient made one), 2) Nominated healthcare proxy, 3) Spouse, 4) Adult children, 5) Parents, 6) Siblings. Life support removal: Supreme Court guidelines - medical board + High Court approval for passive euthanasia. Best interest: Decisions must be in patient's best interest - not family's convenience.

samples.instruction: ICU-la patient paarkka vidala - rights irukkaa?
samples.current_output: Limited visiting is normal, but complete denial is not. Rights: 1) Regular updates from doctor (minimum once daily), 2) Brief visits allowed (usually 2-3 times/day, 10-15 mins), 3) One attendant may stay (not inside ICU). If denied: 1) Request meeting with treating doctor, 2) Escalate to hospital admin, 3) Get updates in writing. Exception: Highly infectious cases - isolation needed.

Decision hierarchy: 1) Advance directive (if patient made one), 2) Nominated healthcare proxy, 3) Spouse, 4) Adult children, 5) Parents, 6) Siblings. Life support removal: Supreme Court guidelines - medical board + High Court approval for passive euthanasia. Best interest: Decisions must be in patient's best interest - not family's convenience.

Don't panic! First: 1) Consult doctor who ordered test - they know context, 2) Slightly abnormal ‚â† disease, 3) Reference ranges vary by lab, 4) Single test may not be conclusive, 5) Repeat test may be needed. Common false positives: Dehydration, recent food, medications. Important: Don't Google and self-diagnose. Doctor will: Correlate with symptoms, order confirmatory tests if needed, explain significance.

Emergency: 108 (ambulance), 102 (pregnant women). Health info: 104 (general health helpline), 1075 (COVID - still active). Disease specific: 1097 (HIV/AIDS), 1800-599-0019 (TB). Mental health: 9152987821 (iCALL), 1800-599-0019 (NIMHANS). Poison: 1066 (Chennai). Child: 1098 (Childline). Women: 181 (women helpline). All 24x7 and free.

Yes! Your right. Options: 1) Same lab - request repeat test (may charge or free depending), 2) Different NABL-accredited lab, 3) Hospital lab if admission. Red flags: 1) Result doesn't match symptoms, 2) Drastic change from previous, 3) Clerical errors visible. Lab liability: Wrong report causing harm = negligence. Verify: NABL accreditation for reliability.

samples.instruction: Emergency contraceptive pill - eppadi use panradhu?
samples.current_output: When: After unprotected sex to prevent pregnancy. Time: Within 72 hours (3 days) - earlier = more effective. Available: 1) Pharmacy (no prescription for most), 2) Government hospitals - free. Brands: I-pill, Unwanted-72, etc. How: Single dose or two doses 12 hours apart. Not for: Regular use (regular contraception better). Side effects: Nausea, period changes - temporary. NOT an abortion pill.

Chennai facilities: 1) National Institute of Siddha (NIS), Tambaram - Premier institute, 200 beds, all specialties, 2) Government Siddha Medical College Hospital, Arumbakkam - Oldest college, teaching hospital, 3) Arignar Anna Government Hospital of Indian Medicine - Multiple AYUSH systems. Services: Free OPD, IPD, medicines, special therapies. Timings: Usually 8 AM - 4 PM OPD.

Naturopathy = Treatment using nature's elements. Methods: Water (hydrotherapy), mud, air, sun, diet, fasting, yoga. Difference from Ayurveda: 1) No medicines (mostly), 2) Focus on lifestyle correction, 3) More recent system, 4) Emphasizes fasting/detox. Combined: Often practiced with Yoga. Qualification: BNYS (Bachelor of Naturopathy and Yogic Sciences). Good for: Lifestyle diseases, prevention, detoxification.

Assessment: 1) Child psychiatrist, 2) Developmental pediatrician, 3) Clinical psychologist. Government: 1) Institute of Child Health (Chennai), 2) District Early Intervention Centres (DEIC), 3) Medical college child psychiatry. Services: Diagnosis, therapy (occupational, speech, behavioral), medicines if needed. Free: Government facilities. Schools: Special needs provisions mandatory. UDID: Apply for benefits if certified.

Indigestion: 1) Jeera (cumin) water, 2) Ajwain (omam) water, 3) Buttermilk with curry leaves, ginger, 4) Ginger + lemon + salt before meals. Acidity: 1) Cold milk, 2) Banana, 3) Coconut water. Constipation: 1) Triphala powder at night, 2) Isabgol (psyllium), 3) Warm water in morning. Gas/bloating: 1) Hing (asafoetida) in warm water, 2) Fennel seeds after meal. Diet: Eat on time, chew well, avoid late dinner.

Yes! Mandatory under Clinical Establishments Act. Display: 1) Room charges (all categories), 2) ICU charges, 3) OT charges, 4) Common procedure rates, 5) Consultation fees, 6) Emergency charges. Where: Reception area, website. Not displayed: Complaint to DHS. Rate revision: Must give notice. Hidden charges: Consumer Forum complaint.

Options: 1) Government hospitals - free (limited slots), 2) NGOs - free/subsidized (iCall, Snehi, etc.), 3) Private practitioners - Rs.500-3000/session, 4) Online platforms - Rs.300-1500/session (Practo, Amaha, YourDOST). Types: Clinical psychologist, counselor, psychiatrist (for medicines). Verify: RCI registration for psychologists. Tip: Many offer sliding scale fees based on income.

samples.instruction: Cosmetic surgery gone wrong - refund/compensation kidaikkumaa?
samples.current_output: Trickier than medical treatment cases. Issues: 1) Subjective expectations, 2) Inherent risks, 3) No guaranteed outcomes. Claim if: 1) Promised results not delivered, 2) Complications due to negligence, 3) Unqualified surgeon, 4) No proper consent. Proof: Before/after photos, advertisements/promises made, consent form, expert opinion. Consumer Forum: Deficiency in service.

Panchakarma = 5 purification/detoxification procedures. 1) Vamana - Therapeutic vomiting (Kapha disorders), 2) Virechana - Purgation (Pitta disorders), 3) Basti - Medicated enema (Vata disorders), 4) Nasya - Nasal administration (head/neck disorders), 5) Raktamokshana - Blood letting (blood disorders). Pre-procedures: Snehapanam (oil intake), Swedanam (sweating). Post: Specific diet restrictions. Duration: 14-21 days ideally.

Dos: 1) Listen without judgment, 2) Take them seriously, 3) Stay with them, 4) Remove means (medicines, sharp objects), 5) Encourage professional help, 6) Call helpline together. Don'ts: 1) Don't leave alone if immediate risk, 2) Don't promise secrecy, 3) Don't argue or lecture, 4) Don't dare them. Emergency: Take to hospital emergency if attempt made or imminent risk. You're not alone - helplines guide you too.

samples.instruction: CCRS (Central Council for Research in Siddha) enna seigiradhu?
samples.current_output: CCRS Chennai: Siddha research organization under Ministry of AYUSH. Functions: 1) Clinical research on Siddha formulations, 2) Drug standardization, 3) Documentation of manuscripts, 4) Clinical trials, 5) Publication of research. OPD: Research centres have OPD - free. Important work: Validated many traditional formulations. Location: Arumbakkam, Chennai. Publications: Siddha research journals, textbooks.

samples.instruction: Ayurveda-padi enna food combinations avoid pannanum?
samples.current_output: Viruddha Ahara (incompatible foods): 1) Milk + fruit (except banana, mango), 2) Milk + fish/meat, 3) Honey + hot water, 4) Curd at night, 5) Cold water after meals, 6) Fruit after meals (eat separately), 7) Milk + sour foods. Why: Causes Ama (toxins), indigestion, diseases. Good combinations: Rice + dal, bread + vegetables. Rule: Eat warm, freshly cooked food. Avoid: Refrigerated/reheated food regularly.

samples.instruction: Stroke symptoms enna? FAST endraal enna?
samples.current_output: FAST test: F - Face drooping (one side), A - Arm weakness (can't raise one arm), S - Speech difficulty (slurred), T - Time to call emergency. Other symptoms: Sudden confusion, vision problem, severe headache, walking difficulty. Action: 1) Call 108, 2) Note time symptoms started (important for treatment), 3) Don't give food/water (swallowing problem possible). Window: 3-4.5 hours for clot-busting treatment.
